info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 08 at 8:26AM CDT until June 08 at 8:45AM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 AM CDT FOR CHILDRESS...NORTHEASTERN MOTLEY...NORTHERN COTTLE AND EASTERN HALL COUNTIES... At 825 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 4 miles west of Cee Vee to near Goodlett, moving south at 70 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. At 810 AM CDT the West Texas Mesonet in Childress reported a wind gust of 60 mph. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Childress, Memphis, Cee Vee, Tell, Kirkland, Swearingen and Estelline. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
